sentence.Network_en: How easy it has been in this febrile atmosphere to point the finger at miscreant journalists.
sentence.Network_cn: 在目前这股热潮中,对那些不道德的记者指指戳戳是多么的容易.

I ordered the miscreants to let me out ., 我命令这些土匪放我出去.
soon after the departure of the couple , a gang of miscreants made their appearance , behaved boisterously , ate and drank without making payment .这对男女刚走，就来了一帮无赖，吵得翻天覆地，大吃大喝一通，竟然分文不付。
基本解释 ◎ 人类渣滓 rénlèi zhāzi[miscreant among people] 人中的败类与“人类渣滓” 相关的成语人类渣滓人类人类学渣滓新新人类人类世人类人种.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as an adjective in the sense 'disbelieving'): from Old French mescreant, present participle of mescreire 'disbelieve', from mes- 'mis-' + creire 'believe' (from Latin credere)

entry.def: A miscreant is someone who has done something illegal or behaved badly.

example.ex: Local people demanded that the District Magistrate apprehend the miscreants.
example.tran: 当地人要求地方法官逮捕那些歹徒。
